contentrichtext.text: [[File:Scot1975EttLaud.png|thumb|Ettrick & Lauderdale, 1975-96]] '''Ettrick and Lauderdale''' ('''''Eadaraig agus Srath Labhdair''''' in [[Scottish Gaelic]]) was one of four local government districts in the [[Scottish Borders|Borders]] region of [[Scotland]] from 1975 to 1996. The district was formed by the [[Local Government (Scotland) Act 1973]] from: *The entire [[counties of Scotland|county]] of [[Selkirkshire]] *Part of [[Berwickshire]] (the burgh of Lauder and most of the West district of the county) *Part of [[Midlothian]] (Heriot and Stow) *Part of [[Roxburghshire]] (the burgh of Melrose and most of Melrose district). In 1989 the district was enlarged by the addition of the Brothershiels area from the neighbouring district of Midlothian.<ref>The Lothian and Borders Regions and Midlothian and Ettrick and Lauderdale Districts (Brothershiels) Boundaries Amendment Order 1989 (S.I.1989 No. 235 (S.23))[http://www.opsi.gov.uk/si/si1989/Uksi_19890235_en_1.htm]</ref> The district council's headquarters were in [[Galashiels]]. The district had an estimated population of 35,490 in 1994.<ref>House of Commons Hansard Written Answers for 18 Mar 1996 [http://www.publications.parliament.uk/pa/cm199596/cmhansrd/vo960318/text/60318w16.htm]</ref> In 1996 the [[Local Government etc (Scotland) Act 1994]] replaced the two-tier regions and districts with unitary council areas. The region and four districts were merged to form the present [[Scottish Borders]] area. *The district's title still forms part of the name of the [[Tweeddale, Ettrick and Lauderdale (Scottish Parliament constituency)|Tweeddale, Ettrick and Lauderdale]] Scottish Parliament constituency. *Ettrick and Lauderdale Divisional Court, whose area corresponds to the former district, sits at Selkirk.<ref>[http://www.district-courts.org/ettrick.htm Scottish Borders - Ettrick and Lauderdale Division (District Courts Association)]</ref> *Ettrick and Lauderdale Sports Council promotes interest and participation in sport in the area covered by the former Ettrick and Lauderdale District Council.<ref>[http://www.elsports.org.uk/ Ettrick and Lauderdale Sports Council]</ref> *[[Lord Lieutenant of Roxburgh, Ettrick and Lauderdale|Roxburgh, Ettrick and Lauderdale]] is one of the [[lieutenancy areas of Scotland]]. ==See also== *[[Subdivisions of Scotland]] ==References== <references/> [[Category:Ettrick and Lauderdale| ]]
